context_evidences: - She said the videos did not show signs of a fentanyl overdose "where someone becomes very sleepy and then just sort of gradually, calmly, peacefully stops breathing." Nor did they show a sudden death, as from a heart attack. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/us/arrest-videos-undercut-derek-chauvins-murder-trial-defense-pathologist-tells-2021-04-09/ published on 2021-04-09 15:58:38

- Peter T. Lin, a forensic and general autopsy pathologist ( here ), told Reuters that fentanyl levels alone are not a clear indicator of the cause and manner of death, as the process depends on “the totality of the facts involving a particular case – not a simple number on a toxicology report.” Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-george-floyd-overdose-death/fact-check-no-evidence-drug-overdose-was-main-cause-of-death-for-george-floyd-in-2020-idUSL1N3241XJ published on 2022-11-08 19:27:40

- The report listed several additional factors as “significant conditions” contributing to Floyd’s death, including heart disease, high blood pressure and intoxication from the powerful opioid fentanyl, as well as recent methamphetamine use. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-autopsy/george-floyd-was-infected-with-covid-19-autopsy-reveals-idUSKBN23B1HX published on 2020-06-04 10:17:02

- The autopsy, in listing cardiopulmonary arrest as the cause of Floyd’s death, also cited “complicating law enforcement subdual, restraint and neck compression.” Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-autopsy/george-floyd-was-infected-with-covid-19-autopsy-reveals-idUSKBN23B1HX published on 2020-06-04 10:17:02

- Other medical experts called by prosecutors have spent the past two days pointing to the unusually large amount of video of the death, from multiple angles, saying it shores up Baker's finding, and contradicts the defense theory of an overdose. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/us/arrest-videos-undercut-derek-chauvins-murder-trial-defense-pathologist-tells-2021-04-09/ published on 2021-04-09 15:58:38

- “Mr. Floyd’s use of fentanyl did not cause the subdual or the neck restraint, his heart disease did not cause the subdual or the neck restraint,” Baker told the jury. He added that while Floyd suffered from heart disease, and fentanyl and methamphetamine found in his blood may have played a role in the death, they “were not direct causes.” Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-george-floyd-overdose-death/fact-check-no-evidence-drug-overdose-was-main-cause-of-death-for-george-floyd-in-2020-idUSL1N3241XJ published on 2022-11-08 19:27:40
correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. Medical examiners and independent experts testified that George Floyd's death was a homicide caused by "cardiopulmonary arrest complicating law enforcement subdual, restraint and neck compression." While Floyd had fentanyl in his system, there is no evidence that it was the main cause of his death. The cause of death was ruled as cardiopulmonary arrest due to law enforcement actions. 
References: 
https://www.reuters.com/world/us/arrest-videos-undercut-derek-chauvins-murder-trial-defense-pathologist-tells-2021-04-09/
https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-george-floyd-overdose-death/fact-check-no-evidence-drug-overdose-was-main-cause-of-death-for-george-floyd-in-2020-idUSL1N3241XJ
https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-autopsy/george-floyd-was-infected-with-covid-19-autopsy-reveals-idUSKBN23B1HX
note_1_text: George Floyd's autopsy did show high levels of drugs in his system, and while it would be reasonable to point to this as a contributory cause to his death, the direct cause was "cardiopulmonary arrest complicating law enforcement subdual, restraint and neck compression".    https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-george-floyd-overdose-death/fact-check-no-evidence-drug-overdose-was-main-cause-of-death-for-george-floyd-in-2020-idUSL1N3241XJ
note_2_text: The autopsy has a fentanyl level of 11 ng/mL and a methamphetamine level  of 19 ng/mL:  https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/6936176/Autopsy-2020-3700-Floyd.pdf    Blood concentrations of approximately 7 ng/ml or greater have been associated with fatalities where poly-substance use was involved.  https://www.emcdda.europa.eu/publications/drug-profiles/fentanyl    Some deaths have happened at even lower amounts https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6609322/table/t0001/
queries:
1. George Floyd cause of death
2. George Floyd autopsy report
3. George Floyd fentanyl overdose claim fact check
refute_evidences: - Baker ruled last year that Floyd's death was a homicide caused by "cardiopulmonary arrest complicating law enforcement subdual, restraint and neck compression." In short, he found that Floyd's heart stopped beating and his lungs stopped working because Chauvin, 45, and other officers compressed him against the road in a way that starved his body of oxygen. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/us/arrest-videos-undercut-derek-chauvins-murder-trial-defense-pathologist-tells-2021-04-09/ published on 2021-04-09 15:58:38

- Medical examiners and independent experts testified in the Chauvin trial that while Floyd suffered from heart disease and hypertension, and toxicology tests showed recent use of the two drugs, none of these was the cause of Floyd’s death on May 25, 2020. Medical examiners ruled the death a homicide because law enforcement officers compressed Floyd against the road in a way that starved his body of oxygen, known as asphyxia, leading to cardiopulmonary arrest. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-george-floyd-overdose-death/fact-check-no-evidence-drug-overdose-was-main-cause-of-death-for-george-floyd-in-2020-idUSL1N3241XJ published on 2022-11-08 19:27:40

- The coroner ruled the manner of death to be a homicide. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-autopsy/george-floyd-was-infected-with-covid-19-autopsy-reveals-idUSKBN23B1HX published on 2020-06-04 10:17:02

- However, no publicly-available evidence supports the claim that Floyd died from overdosing on drugs, specifically fentanyl and methamphetamine, rather than from the actions of law enforcement officers. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-george-floyd-overdose-death/fact-check-no-evidence-drug-overdose-was-main-cause-of-death-for-george-floyd-in-2020-idUSL1N3241XJ published on 2022-11-08 19:27:40

- The official cause of death, according to the full 20-page report made public on Wednesday by the Hennepin County Medical Examiner’s Office, was cardiopulmonary arrest while Floyd was being restrained by police taking him into custody on May 25. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-autopsy/george-floyd-was-infected-with-covid-19-autopsy-reveals-idUSKBN23B1HX published on 2020-06-04 10:17:02

- "Mr. Floyd's use of fentanyl did not cause the subdual or the neck restraint, his heart disease did not cause the subdual or the neck restraint," Baker told the jury, using medical jargon to refer to the way police pressed Floyd face down against the street. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/us/arrest-videos-undercut-derek-chauvins-murder-trial-defense-pathologist-tells-2021-04-09/ published on 2021-04-09 15:58:38
